context.p: Perform this procedure to initialize DRBD and the mirrored storage areas.
context.note: Unlike the preceding procedures, most of the steps in this procedure are performed on the primary node only.

step.cmd: Log in to the primary node .
Synchronize the storage areas of both nodes.

substep.stepresult: The command may return right away, while the synchronization process continues running in the background. Depending on the sizes of the storage areas, this process can take several hours.

substep.cmd: Monitor the progress of the synchronization.

stepresult.p: Do not proceed until the status is UpToDate/UpToDate, as in the following example output:
stepresult.codeblock: 0:serviced-dfs/0 Connected Primary/Secondary UpToDate/UpToDate 1:serviced-dfs/1 Connected Primary/Secondary UpToDate/UpToDate 2:serviced-dfs/2 Connected Primary/Secondary UpToDate/UpToDate
stepresult.p: The Primary/Secondary values show that the command was run on the primary node; otherwise, the values are Secondary/Primary. Likewise, the first value in the UpToDate/UpToDate field is the status of the node on which the command is run, and the second value is the status of the remote node.

step.cmd: Format the block storage for internal services data and for metadata.
step.info: The following commands use the paths of the DRBD devices defined previously, not the block storage paths.
step.stepresult: The commands create XFS filesystems on the primary node, and DRBD mirrors the filesystems to the secondary node.

step.cmd: Create a device mapper thin pool for application data.
step.info: The following command uses the path of the DRBD device defined previously, not the block storage path.
step.stepresult: On success, DRBD mirrors the device mapper thin pool to the secondary node.

substep.cmd: Locate the line for the SERVICED_FS_TYPE variable, and then make a copy of the line, immediately below the original.
Locate the line for the SERVICED_DM_THINPOOLDEV variable, and then make a copy of the line, immediately below the original.
Set the value to the device mapper name of the thin pool for application data.

step.cmd: In a separate window, log in to the secondary node , and then replicate the configuration on the secondary node.
step.info: Use a utility like sum to compare the files and ensure their contents are identical.

step.cmd: On the primary node, monitor the progress of the synchronization.

stepresult.note: Do not proceed until synchronization is complete.

step.cmd: On the primary node, deactivate the serviced volume group.
